sub_title: Scientific Director, ERC Consolidator grantee, Guest assistant professor Delft University
summary:
- Research novel wireless technology for intracortcal brain computer interfaces (iBCIs) under ERC Consolidator grant - Intranet of Neurons
- Contribute to the evolution of ultra-low-power (from 100 to 1mW) wireless for IoT and implantable applications
- Present several advanced digital-intensive CMOS RF/analog circuit and architecture concept
- Extensive collaborate with industrial partners in developing production-ready low-power transceivers
- Explore cutting edge RF-based sensing technologies for various applications in biomedical, healthcare, chemical, presence detection
- Actively involve in the review, presentation, and organization of top notch scientific conferences

Specialties: Implantable telemetry, Energy-efficient RF/analog ASIC design, Wireless communication, Radar

treasury_media.title: Prestigious ERC Consolidator Grant Awarded To Imec’s Yao-Hong Liu to Develop Miniature, Energy-efficient, and High-capacity Wireless Network For Data Transfer of Brain-Wide Neural Recordings | imec

patents.title: Impulse generation method and impulse-radio transmitter

awards.title: IEEE SSCS–Brain Best Paper Award Honorable Mention 2022
awards.description:
An honorable mention went to “A 1.66 Gb/s and 5.8 pJ/b Transcutaneous IR-UWB Telemetry System 
with Hybrid Impulse Modulation for Intracortical Brain-Computer Interfaces”
This paper, which was presented at ISSCC 2022, describes a wireless telemetry for high-bandwidth 
iBCI, based on an impulse-radio ultrawideband (IR-UWB) ASIC. A hybrid impulse modulation is roposed in this paper [Figure 6(c)] to increase modulation order without significantly increasing the 
radio requirement. An energy-efficient asynchronous digital-polar transmitter that can support the 
proposed hybrid modulation is presented, which consumes extreme low power below 10 mW, thus leading to a record high data rate of 1.66 Gb/s and an energy efficiency of 5.8 pJ/bit [Figure 6(d)]. The presented telemetry module integrating this IR-UWB ASIC and an on-board antenna occupies only 1.05-cm2 area [Figure 6(b)], making it an ideal wireless telemetry for high channelcount brain-wide iBCIs.

awards.title: Awarded Consolidator grant from European Research Council (ERC)
awards.description:
The European Research Council (ERC) has awarded a prestigious Consolidator Grant to Yao-Hong Liu, principal member of technical staff at imec at Holst Centre the Netherlands, for his project Intranet of Neurons (IoN). 
IoN aims to revolutionize the way neuroscientists collect and process neural data by enabling the efficient transfer at high data rate from high-density sub-dural implanted recording probes while maintaining a small footprint required for minimally invasive surgery. The new wireless telemetry network that is proposed has the capacity to support 10's of distributed recording nodes (enabling a greater than 10,000 channels) simultaneously. IoN will significantly scale up brain-wide recordings and propel research into brain-computer interfaces forward. Yao-Hong Liu receives 2 million euro for this ambitious 5-year project.
https://www.imec-int.com/en/press/prestigious-erc-consolidator-grant-awarded-imecs-yao-hong-liu-develop-miniature-energy

awards.title: ISSCC 2019 best integrated system presentation award
awards.description: Presented and demonstrated an extremely power efficient radar system for occupancy and vital sign detection. A novel burst chirp radar waveform is proposed, which lead to record low power consumption and long detection distance. The power consumption is only 0.6mW, which can be powered by coin batteries. The detection distance of human's vital sign is up to 15 meters.

awards.title: Outstanding PhD research award
awards.description: A super-regenerative receiver with a novel delta-sigma pulse-width digitizer is presented. This research focused on solving the time resolution limit when demodulating the signal level of the super-regenerative receiver. This allows higher order ASK modulation to be used by super-regenerative receiver to increase energy efficiency.

projects.title: ERC funded research - Intranet of Neurons
projects.description: This is a 5 year research project funded from European Research Council. The research scope is wireless telemetry and neural signal processing technology for brain-wide distributed intracortical brain-computer interfaces

profile_positions.description:
- Conduct new research in implantable wireless technology for brain computer interfaces (BCIs) under ERC Consolidator grant - Intranet of Neurons
- Contribute to the evolution of ultra-low power radio (BLE/Zigbee/IEEE802.15.6/802.11ah/UWB)  for IoT and healthcare applications
- Develop record low-power wireless sub-systems (e.g., sub-mW digital PLL, UWB radar)
- Extensive collaborate with imec's industrial and academic partners, and support them to achieve successful outcome
- Contributed to the definition of imec research roadmap which leads new industrial valorization (e.g., radar sensing, low-power frequency generation, implantable brain-computer interface, etc)
- Grow critical competence of the team to adapt imec's fast-changing development of new technologies
- Serve as the steering committee member in IEEE RFIC symposium
profile_positions.title: Scientific Director

profile_positions.description:
As the co-promotor of the PhD researcher from ERC-Intranet of Neurons (IoN), in Bioelectronics group of EEMCS department.
Research area - Implantable wireless communication, powering and computation for neural applications.
profile_positions.title: Guest Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: Supervision and co-promotion of PhD and MSc in research area of implantable wireless communication and computation for brain-computer interfaces.
profile_positions.title: Distinguished research associate (guest)

profile_positions.description:
- Involved in 0.13um CMOS WiMAX, WiFi-MIMO(b/g/n) and PHS transceiver product development
- Designed high-quality fractional-N PLLs, direct-conversion transmitters and low-power analog baseband for OFDM transceivers
- Involved in specification and planning of OFDM transmitter system
- Developed advance digital-assisted offset compensation and transmitter loop-back calibration techniques
profile_positions.title: Technical Manager/Staff RFIC Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Involved in 0.35um BiCMOS GSM, WiFi and 0.18um CMOS WCDMA transceiver product development
- Successfully delivered high-performance receiver RF front-ends and ultra-low-noise VCO for cellular applications
- Built up receiver noise and sensitivity characterization environment
profile_positions.title: Senior RF/Analog IC Engineer

profile_positions.description: -Designed 0.25um CMOS RF GFSK transmitter for Bluetooth
profile_positions.title: RF/Analog IC Design Engineer

profile_positions.description:
-Build up on-wafer RFIC measurement system
-RFIC system characterization (modualtion quality measurement)
profile_positions.title: Interm RFIC Engineer
